<small>Hebrew form: **<big>[[H1887|הֵא]]</big>**</small>
 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הָא‎</span> **demonstrative particle** ==lo! behold!== (Biblical Hebrew  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֵא‎</span> (twice); Egyptian Aramaic and Têma <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הא‎</span> ([[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>193, 198</sup>); [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הָא‎</span>; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Mandean <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הא‎</span> ([[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>M 81</sup>); Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> in Aramaic also often prefixed to pronoun 3 person for greater definiteness, as [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הָהוּא‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (for <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***h¹-h¥***</u></abbr>), see [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>M 89 f.</sup> [[BDB#W|W]]<sup>CG 106 f.</sup>), [[Dan.3.25|Dan 3:25]]. 

<small>Also see: **<big>[[H1983|הֲלָךְ]]</big>**</small>

 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵא‎</span> **demonstrative particle**, prefixed idiomatically to <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כְּ‎</span> for greater definiteness, literally ***behold like*** (Biblical Hebrew  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֵא‎</span>, see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָא‎</span> above), only in <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵאכְּֿ דִי‎</span> [[Dan.2.43|Dan 2:43]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵאכְּֿ דִי‎</span> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎פַרְזְלָא לָא מִתְעָרַב‎</span> ***like as*** iron doth not mingle with clay (compare 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** <lookup onclick="bdbabb('Tg')"><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵑ7‎</span><sup>**Onk**</sup></lookup> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הָא כְמַיָּא‎</span> [[Gen.49.4|Gen 49:4]], so [[BDB#Sept|ᵑ7]]<sup>**Jon**</sup> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הא כ‎</span> [[Isa.5.28|Isa 5:28]]; [[Isa.9.4|Isa 9:4]] + often; [[BDB#Sept|ᵑ7]]<sup>**Jer**</sup> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵי כ‎</span> [[Gen.26.4|Gen 26:4]]; [[Gen.26.18|Gen 26:18]]; [[Gen.26.22|Gen 26:22]] + often; <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵיח‎</span> [[Ps.2.9|Ps 2:9]]; [[Ps.5.10|Ps 5:10]]; [[Ps.5.13|Ps 5:13]] +, also pleonastic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵיח כְּ‎</span> [[Ps.22.14|Ps 22:14]]; [[Ps.22.15|Ps 22:15]]; [[Ps.22.17|Ps 22:17]] + often 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵיח‎</span> ***as*** ([[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>259</sup>), as <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎היך בנמוסא‎</span> ***as*** (is) in the law ([[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>321</sup>; so [[BDB#Sept|ᵑ7]]<sup>**Jer**</sup> [[Ps.2.9|Ps 2:9]], etc.), <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵיח דִּי‎</span> conjecture (like Daniel <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵא כְּ דִי‎</span>: = Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כַּאֲשֶׁר‎</span>), as <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎היך די גבא‎</span> ***like as*** he levied, [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>Tariff ii. b 12. 18, c 14. 17. 21. 26</sup> [<lookup onclick="bdbabb('Tg')"><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵑ7‎</span><sup>**Onk Jon**</sup></lookup> for <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כַּאֲשֶׁר‎</span> have <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כְּמָא דְ‎</span>, [[BDB#Sept|ᵑ7]]<sup>**Jer**</sup> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵיכְמָא דְ‎</span>, [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]]. <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">]. It is dubious whether <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵא כְּ דִי‎</span> belongs to **a** (notice especially [[BDB#Sept|ᵑ7]]<sup>**Jon**</sup>) or **b:** [[BDB#Schulth|Schulth]]<sup>ZAW 1902, 164 f.</sup> to 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** reading <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵאח דִּי‎</span> (but <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎א‎</span> rare and late: [[BDB#Dalm|D]]<sup></sup> (2) § 45. 1); [[BDB#Nes|Nes]]<sup>OLtz. 1892, 488</sup> from <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵיח‎</span> (see Biblical Hebrew) ***how ?***).
